title: We are in a SoftBank bubble, not a tech bubble
text:
The year’s biggest tech flotation has flopped. Other companies are pulling their listings altogether and been forced to accept dramatically reduced valuations. Elsewhere, early-stage start-ups are cutting staff in a bid to stay afloat.

These sound very much like the early stages of a tech bubble getting ready to burst. The taxi app Uber, whose hotly-anticipated initial public offering valued it at $80bn (£62bn) in May, has since seen shares fall by almost 30pc.

Last week the office provider WeWork, which at one point had hoped to be worth a similar amount, was forced to accept a rescue package valuing it at just $8bn. A day later a California car subscription start-up called Fair lost 40pc of...
description: The year’s biggest tech flotation has flopped.
